alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 21 at 3:28PM EDT until May 21 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: The National Weather Service in Caribou Maine has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Aroostook County in northern Maine... * Until 415 PM EDT. * At 328 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 18 miles southwest of Estcourt Station to near Saint Pamphile to near Daaquam, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Fort Kent, Eagle Lake, Allagash, Clayton Lake, Deboullie Mountain, Frenchville, New Canada, Nine-mile Bridge, Allagash Township, Fish River Lake, Dickey, Wallagrass, Winterville, Saint Francis, Daigle, Soldier Pond, Round Pond and Saint John. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
